subject: Re: Which lexical set is the second vowel of _because_ in?
msgSnippet: ... (KIT, ... schwa? ... which ... are ... I ve now changed my mind on these words and have added them to the hardbasket.  Perhaps the best thing to do is to
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:
>
> Benct Philip Jonsson scripsit:
>
> > But surely any 'low-content' with a vowel frem the 'checked' group
(KIT,
> > DRESS, TRAP, FOOT, STRUT, LOT) can get a de-stressed form with
schwa?
> > And surely these words should be spellad as if stressed even when
> > they aren't?
>
> True but not relevant here. No matter how much I stress the words
> "of" and "from" (as in the phrase "of but not from", where they have
> contrastive stress), the vowel remains /V/ and never becomes /A/,
which
> means that they belong to STRUT and not LOT for me. Not all words
are
> absolutely invariant as to lexical set.
>

I've now changed my mind on these words and have added them to the
hardbasket. Perhaps the best thing to do is to include them in two
sets.
